head.supplied: ¶ [A letter from Baron Von Mueller was read in which complaint was made concerning the cows of the Home having been found roaming about the Govt House Reserve also requesting the removal of the shed ...

div.p: Executive Committee minute book, Immigrants Aid Society records, Mount Royal Hospital, Melbourne.

Transcribed 30.6.93. To proof.
Letter not found; item is an extract from the minutes of a meeting of the Executive Committee held on 15 March 1872. The letter was probably addressed to either the Superintendent of the Immigrants Aid Society Home, James Saunders Greig, or the Honorary Secretary to the Committee of Management, Alfred Woolley.
[A letter from Baron Von Mueller was read in which complaint was made concerning the cows of the Home having been found roaming about the Govt House Reserve also requesting the removal of the shed The Supt explained that the animals had by some means unknown got out of the yard, but had wanted about the marshy part only and done no harm.
